alert.note: Alert for Chambers (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 4:39AM CST until January 09 at 7:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chambers, Lee, Macon, Randolph and Tallapoosa. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 439 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Opelika, Tuskegee, Valley, Lanett, Roanoke, Tallassee, Dadeville, Camp Hill, Notasulga, Lafayette, Stroud, Milstead, La Fayette, Jacksons` Gap, Wadley, Shorter, Franklin, Waverly and Lakeview.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
